intro: Secamone fryeri, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its striking, fragrant white flowers that bloom at night. The plant has elliptical, dark green leaves and produces small, berry-like fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested or swampy areas. Due to its ornamental value and unique blooming habits, it is cultivated in some regions for horticultural purposes.
